dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: It’s a cigarette! Okay? It’s a fucking cigarette. Josh looks to Zach for confirmation. None is forthcoming, he looks to Charlie. Charlie glances at Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That’s what it looks like. Josh isn’t buying it. He can tell they’re trying to avoid confrontation.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Bull. Give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: My cigarette? What are you gonna do with it?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Daryl!

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Come get it! He tries to make a game out of it, waving the sword aroun

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: If you took the bag just give it back to him. Daryl sighs, angry at Zach’s betrayal. He starts off, swo in hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Daryl, come on. Zach grabs his shoulder. Daryl SPINS around, lifting the sword. ZACH (cont'd) Shit!  Angry, he bats the sword away. ZACH (cont'd) What the hell? Daryl shakes his head, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Fuck you guys. He flicks his joint/cigarette at Zach’s face, sticks the sword into the ground and storms off. Charlie is clearly uncomfortable, not wanting to take sides.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Just leave him alone for minute. He'll calm down. Josh calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You steal anything else from my family? Daryl ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: How would you like it if I went to your house and took shit from you? Oh that's right, you don't have anything because you live in a fucking duplex. 43. Daryl turns around and takes a few steps toward the group

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Hey Zach, thanks for inviting me out. Too bad your boyfriend's on the rag. Make sure to slap him around a little bit tonight, keep him in line.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: This is stupid, give me the bag. Daryl pulls the bag of weed from his jacket and hands it over. Zach stoops to pick up the samurai sword. He turns them both over to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Here's your stuff back.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Guess we should call it a day. Zach shakes his head at Josh and they all start to head b to the road. Charlie winces at Daryl, trying to cheer him up. Jeez, th was nuts. It doesn’t work. Daryl turns away from him, he' angry, embarrassed. They walk in silence for a moment, heading out of the fie Suddenly, Daryl takes a SWING at the back of Josh’s head.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Stop! But Daryl’s on him, swinging like crazy. Pissed. Charlie and Zach look at one another, each expecting the other to step in and stop them. Josh and Daryl wrestle in the grass. Charlie tries to lau at the ridiculousness of the situation as he shouts at th CHARLIE (cont'd) * Okay! Stop it, guys! * And then there’s a SCREAM. No. Screams. From both of them One of pain. The other of horror. Zach kneels beside the struggling pair.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD
dialogues.text: In the grass (or snow). Everywhere. *

dialogues.speaker: THE SWORD
dialogues.text: Is embedded in Daryl’s neck. Charlie finally loses his co Completely. He shrieks. CHARLIE (cont'd) Oh my god, oh my god! Zach is horrified.  45.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Jesus, Josh!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I didn’t! He fell! Daryl GASPS for air. Trying to speak. He can’t. It’d be s much better if he didn’t try, if he didn’t GURGLE.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Oh god, what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Take it out! Take it out!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No! But it’s too late. Zach’s already removed the sword and tossed it aside. GUSH! A spray of crimson into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: YOU’RE SUPPOSED TO LEAVE IT IN! Charlie’s lost it. His adolescent voice is cracking. He lunges at Zach. Swats at him. Zach shoves him back and Charlie goes sprawling on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Crawls away, hand over the gaping hole in his throat. He gets to his feet, looks down at himself, at the blood. takes off running further into the woods. Charlie stands, dumbfounded, calling after him. CHARLIE (cont'd) Daryl! But Daryl is running on pure instinct. He has no idea wha to do, where to go. He’s just running

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Burbling as he goes. Josh and Zach race after him. Calling for him to slow dow  32 46. He can barely hear. The BEATING of his heart and the heaviness of his BREATH are the only sounds that reach hi He enters the surrounding

dialogues.speaker: FOREST
dialogues.text: His eyes are closed. A sprinter at the finish line. His foot hits the ground at an odd angle. It twists underneath him, sending him sprawling forward and tumblin into a ditch. Josh and Zach arrive, out of breath, shivering with adrenaline. They look down into

dialogues.speaker: THE DITCH
dialogues.text: It’s a six or seven foot drop to the bottom. That’s where Daryl is lying, face down. His ankle is twisted gruesomel He isn’t moving. The guys are completely at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is he--

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. We need to check on him. Do you know how to check for a pulse?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: His neck or his wrist, right? Stalemate. Neither wants to do it. Zach stares at Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I know. Zach looks around and sizes up the best way to climb down He slowly makes his way to Daryl and kneels beside his he He reaches out, trying to avoid the wound. The blood. He presses his fingers to Daryl’s neck. He concentrates b it’s hard to tell.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Daryl? 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes him. ZACH (cont'd) Daryl? Daryl, can you hear me? Are you awake, man? Zach bites his lip and does the thing he really doesn’t w to do: He put his hands on either side of DARYL’S HEAD And lifts it up from the ground. Zach kneels lower to the ground and looks at DARYL’S FACE His mouth hangs open and his eyes are blank. With the hea lifted Zach can see the blood continuing to issue from Daryl’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is he... Zach is startled to realize Josh is kneeling behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don't know. I can't tell. You check. Zach gets up and moves away from the scene, after hesitat a moment he vomits on the ground. Dropping to his kneels with the intensity of it. When he finishes he looks up. JOSH is still kneeling over Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He’s dead. The two boys stand in silence for a moment. JOSH seems stunned. No clear emotion on his face. He seem small, helpless. ZACH looks at his friend with sympathy. This is a fucked- problem but he can at least try to help. He thinks for a sustained, silent moment. JOSH (cont'd) Zach. What do we do?  33

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Okay, we need to leave. Zach walks over and picks up a pile of dead leaves and du them on top of Daryl’s body.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Covering him up. Come on, help me.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Are you sure-

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don’t know, it's something.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Where’s Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Shit. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He took off.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He’1l tell! We’ve gotta find him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: How? Do you know where he lives? His phone number? He won’t tell. He’s not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He might try and get help. ...Maybe we should get help. Zach continues burying the body with leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We should hide this too. Zach and Josh turn to see Charlie standing at the edge of teh ditch, clutching the bloody sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In another part of the woods, the boys walk together slowly, looking for a hiding place. 48. Imps

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Over there. He’s pointing at A TREE with an empty hollow in it. Zach removes his sweatshirt and wipes down the sword with it. Then he wedges the sword into the hollow. It’s still visible. He wedges his sweatshirt in over it, then grabs a handful wet pine straw and leaves. He crams it in, camouflaging i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wander through the tall grass back to the road. And

dialogues.speaker: FOUR BIKES
dialogues.text: Parked at the edge of the field. Josh’s, Zach's, Charlie's... and Daryl’s. Charlie looks at the two boys. Without another word he ge his bike and rides off.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’ll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s fine, I’1l move it somewhere. It’1l be dark soon and we shouldn’t both get home late. Josh mounts his bike. He reaches out and touches Zach’s shoulder. It doesn’t seem like enough. He grips it. Pats him, hard.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Thank you. They make eye contact. And then Josh is gone. Zach is alo He takes Daryl’s bike and rides it

dialogues.speaker: UP THE ROAD 35
dialogues.text: A little way until he sees a pasture with horses off to o side. He goes to park the bike against the fence- then thinks for a second and throws it over, obscuring it in t tall grass.  36 37 38 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has just set and the light is disappearing fast. Zach is the only thing on this road. He pumps as hard as can, climbing a hill, reaching the top of it, then beginn his roller coaster-like decent. Only instead of standing up or letting the bike just roll Zach pedals even harder on the incredibly steep downhill slide. He pumps faster and faster, the bike wobbling under the strain of the speed. The wind is blowing on his face and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeezing tears down his face, pumping harder than ever until, finally, at the bottom of the hill, he loses contr of the bike and tumbles down onto the asphalt. He hits the ground hard and continues to roll and scrape himself for several more feet. He lands on his back and l there in the fading light staring up at

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: The stars are just beginning to be visible and the moon i full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach walks his wrecked bike up to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach slips in from the garage. He’s beat up from his fall exhausted from everything else. He walks straight to the and downs a huge glass of water. He doesn’t notice...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Is sitting behind him, watching him with nervous curiosit He fills the glass again. Halfway through it, he sees her and jumps, startled. Surprise quickly turns to confusion. What the hell is she doing here? She waves, a little embarrassed.  51.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Your mom... I just stopped by, she said you’d be back. She went to get come Cokes out of the closet. He just stands there, panting.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Oh... I was on my bike. She notices his bloody elbow.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh god, are you okay? Karen walks in with a case of soda under her arm.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: It’s caffeine free, I hope... Ah, see! There he is. She smirks at him knowingly. Then notices his wound.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You’re bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I fell. On my bike... She lifts his arms to examine it and winces, hissing thro her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: That looks nasty. You should clean it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I will. There’s an awkward beat. Allison is realizing that coming here wasn’t such a great idea. Zach is still spaced out. Karen has to step in.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Zach’s room is upstairs.  52. Zach nods in Allison’s direction and heads up. She follow uncertain. She glances at Karen for support. Karen gives a nod and wave. He’s always like this. INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY/ZACH’S ROOM - EVENING Allison starts babbling behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I was just walking and I passed by... I guess I should have called first but I didn't realize I'd be near your house until I saw it and said "oh that's Zach's house, maybe I should stop and yell ‘handjobs’ at the top of my lungs.” Zach glances back at her. She nods, eyebrow raised. Zach takes a breath and stops by the upstairs bathroom to grab wad of toilet paper. He uses it stop the flow of blood fr his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: She’s right. You should clean that.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I will. Just for now. She nods and follows him into his room. He sits on the be clearly distracted. There’s no place for her to sit.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: »..You want me to go? He doesn’t answer. He’s trying and failing to hold everything in.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I- She’s suddenly, surprisingly earnest.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Don’t apologize. She moves to the doorway, out of his line of sight. He buries his face in his hands, rubbing the temples. The door creaks shut. Click. As soon as he hears it, he lets loose. A big, weird wail. gasp for air. Not tears or sobs exactly.  40 53. Just an exhalation of emotion. He shudders as it leaves h Then he sits back. And sees...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Is still there. She didn’t leave, only closed the door. H instantly startled and embarrassed. She doesn't say anything, just sits beside him on the bed. She puts her arm around him. It's a slightly awkward gest of comfort, but they stay like that and the awkwardness subsides. Zach rests his head on her shoulder. She runs her fingers through his hair and starts to wipe his tears. He reaches and gently grabs her hand, turns to her and brings his li to hers. It's barely a kiss at first, just an extension of intimac but it lingers for a moment before he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is sitting on the sofa, eating toast and reading a trashy novel. She hears them come downstairs and talk quietly in the foyer. The front door opens. And closes. She lays her book down, listening in. There’s nothing to glean, however. Just mumbled goodbyes. Eventually Zach shuffles in.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: A short visit then?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: It’s early.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m tired. Probably just read or something.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Nah.  41 42 54. She can tell something’s wrong but doesn't push him.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Okay. He goes. She tries to let him, but she can't. She's up an following. KAREN (cont'd) I'm cleaning those cuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sits on the closed lid of the toilet while Karen wor around him, dabbing his cuts with iodine and putting band aids on them. He sits motionless, allowing her to perform this motherly task.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Ouch, you might as well play football.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Yeah... fuck football. That almost gets a smile from him and she’s happy enough that. INT. ZACH’S ROOM - NIGHT 42 He’s fidgeting in bed, trying to get comfortable. It’s no working. He can’t sleep. He sits up and sees

dialogues.speaker: A FIGURE
dialogues.text: Sitting on the floor in the corner of his room. He reaches for his bedside lamp. But once it’s switched o he can see there's nobody there. Zach lays back down, but he leaves the bedside lamp on. Eventually, he reaches for his walk-man, puts in a new ta and hits play. We can hear the low rumble of heavy music.  43 44 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from high above: a lone rider cruising down the midd of the road. It's Zach on his busted bike. The chain rattling against the bent gear shaft. He's got his headphones on. Exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids streaming out of the building. Running, screaming, goofing around. Zach is there in the throng, searching frantically. Ah-ha

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Charlie! He flags him down. Charlie is not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: We should talk.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No we shouldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh wasn’t at school today.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So go talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I am. I’m going to, I thought we should get our story straight-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: There’s no story.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: If someone asks-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t remember. I don't remember what I did last Tuesday. Why would I remember what I did this Tuesday? Probably, I went home after school and stayed there alone until my parents got home. Like I do most weekdays.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You’re right. That’s good. ee OF  45 46 56.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So why’d you come running over here to the middle school to talk to an 8th grader you barely know? ...If anyone asks? Shit. Zach hadn’t thought of that. He gets the drift. He gives Charlie a nod.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We’re not friends. EXT. JOSH’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON 45 Zach rings the doorbell. Waits. Nothing. He stares at dow at an old doormat: faded letters that say "Welcome Y'all! He knocks on the door a few times.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh? He goes around the side of the house, peering in windows. lingers outside Josh’s bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh! He pauses and turns to see a NEIGHBOR LADY hosing off her back porch. She’s stopped what she’s doing to squint suspiciously at Zach. He slouches and heads back to the sidewalk and his bike. sighs and heads home. * INT. ZACH’S ROOM - EVENING 46 Zach is pacing, staring at the white cordless phone sitti on his bed when there’s a sudden knock on his door.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Zach? He throws the phone down, equal parts startled and frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sure.  57. He sits on the bed. She enters and scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Do you know a boy named Daryl Harper? Didn’t you two used to play together?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What? Like a long time ago. Why?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: His mother called earlier. I guess he didn’t come home last night. Hasn’t come home yet at all. Was he at school today?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I didn’t see him. I mean, I wasn’t looking.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Sure. Do you remember the last time you did see him?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: »No. Nope.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: She said something about him going to Josh’s yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: He didn’t?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: No. I was with Josh.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Well, I’11 tell her.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. Wish I was more help, I just...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You got in late last night.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I guess so.  47 48 49 50 58.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Don’t do that anymore. I’m sure Daryl will turn up, but... If something happened, if someone... I don’t know. Anyway. Let’s try and stick around the house for the next few days, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off. He's staring at

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: Glow in the dark STAR STICKERS. A cheerful facsimile of t ones he saw outside earlier. A relic of his childhood sti stuck to his ceiling, out of reach. He tosses the covers aside and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach quietly enters and makes his way over to the cupboar He finds a bottle of NYQUIL, unscrews the lid and takes a large swig from it. And then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach creeps in and turns the TV on, keeping the volume lo He sets the "SLEEP TIMER" to 30 minutes and lies down on couch, flipping channels, already growing drowsy. Almost drifting off. INT. ZACH’S ROOM - MORNING 50 BANG BANG BANG! A loud rapping on the door jolts Zach up from sleep. He's bleary eyed. He darts his head around to look at his alarm clock but it's nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah! Ok! Alright! Zach reaches over and peels back the blinds on the window ZACH's POV - a field shrouded in fog; no horizon to see. ZACH (cont'd) What time is it? Mom? Silence.  51 59. ZACH (cont'd) Mom? Again, no response. He slings himself out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach exits his bedroom and walks down the hall. The silen is overwhelming.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey mom? He makes his way into the living room. Nothing, no one. H looks over his shoulder and sees

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Standing in his bedroom doorway. ZACH (cont'd) What the hell man? Daryl points his finger to the ceiling. Something hits Zach's hand. He raises it to his eye. Bloo One drop of blood - but from where? He looks up. A LARGE DARK RED VOID rips through the ceiling, slowly an silently churning like a whirlpool. Zach stares up at it. Then looks back to his hand. He tri frantically tries to wipe off the blood but it's no use, just spreads. His shirt is suddenly soaked in blood, as a his hands, and arms. ZACH (cont'd) No, no, no jesus- Suddenly, he cant breathe, he falls to his knees and reac for his throat. A large gaping hole in his neck, gushing blood. He panics and tries to wipe it away. ZACH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: He spins to find him but he's gone. He scrambles and runs into the bathroom, slams the door and turns to the mirror He's covered in blood, head to toe, dripping. Zach SCREAMS, but there is no sound. The mirror cracks, sending his reflection into a scatter shot of anguish.  52 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZACH HOVERS above the sofa- and then falls suddenly, jolt awake from the nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom!!! He clenches his stomach, tears running down his face. Footsteps. Lights flip on. Karen rushes in in her nightgo

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What!? Honey what is it!? She runs to him, cradles him in her arms. KAREN (cont'd) Shhh. I'm here sweetey, I'm here. Zach struggles to get words out.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It hurts! In my stomach!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Can you describe it? Tell me what it feels like.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It hurts!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Is it a dull pain or a sharp one?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sharp! It's sharp!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Okay honey, I'm going to go get some water, I'll be right back, okay? I'll be right back, sweetheart. She runs out of the room and returns with a glass of wate and a bottle of pepto bismol. KAREN (cont'd) Drink this.  61.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You have to. Now sit up. She helps prop him up. He keels back over. KAREN (cont'd) I know, I know, but this will make it better. Now breath...Count to eight...That's it. She pours some pepto bismol into the cap and brings it to his lips. She rests her hand on his forehead and slowly tilts it back. KAREN (cont'd) There you go. Better?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? Zach shakes his head "no". KAREN (cont'd) You haven't eaten anything, Zach... that's probably what's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I took some nyquil.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Or it could be that. Why did you take nyquil, do you have a cold?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I just couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Okay, well no more of that. You hear me? You can't just take that willy nilly. Especially on an empty stomach... He nods. She pulls down the QUILT draped over the back of the couch and covers him with it. She sits beside him and rests his head in her lap, letting him finally drift off sleep. ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK ee OF  53 54 55 56 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight breaks through the window and dances across Zach eyes, gently rousing him awake. Karen is asleep on the love seat nearby, a book on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Mom. Mom. It's morning, we gotta get up. She rises, startled and confused.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, honey. What time is it? Zach looks at the clock on the mantel.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It's 7.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: SHIT. Shoot. Shoot, okay, gotta go. You get dressed, I'll throw some cereal in a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you get to work?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I will, don't worry, just get changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few stragglers slip into the building. Zach locks his b up, staring at the police car parked at the curb in front

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach walks through the crowd of students. All around him can hear the murmuring of people talking about Daryl’s disappearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire student body is seated in the bleachers. Down the court THE SHERIFF stands with THE PRINCIPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK  57 58 59 63. They share a microphone and talk about how anyone with information should come forward, etc. Zach scans the crowd eventually he spots Allison on the opposite side of the court. He continues looking but does not see Josh anywhere. Just a bunch of faces, a bunch of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students are working silently on a test or something.

dialogues.speaker: AN EMPTY DESK
dialogues.text: Stands out ominously in the middle of the room. Zach is seated toward the back. He looks up at the desk a then back to his work. Suddenly he feels a kick on his chair. He looks over his shoulder to see a girl, CINDY MAPLES, fiddling with a retractable bic pen. She nods at Zach and he watches as she starts to retract pen, bringing the tip up, then down, over and over, faste and faster. Moaning quietly as she does it. Zach keeps watching, not sure what to do. A few girls nea stifle laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is biking alone along the side of the road but sudde slows to stop. He looks all around him and sees nothing moving in any direction. He is the only living thing within view. After a moment h gets up and pedals off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach stands looking at himself in the mirror. He runs his fingers through his hair, pulling it away from his face. He reaches into a drawer and pulls out some electric hair clippers and switches them on. But before he can get at his hair, he’s interrupted by a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OF  64.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah?!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm going to the store do you need anything? He opens the door. She sees the clippers in his hand and makes a frown. KAREN (CONT’D) What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Don't be doing what I think you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I'm not doing anything... She just stares at him, suspecting otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sits in class. The TEACHER is taking role.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Zach Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Joshua Templeton? No answer. TEACHER (cont'd) Josh? No? No Josh? Three days ina row... 61 EXT. JOSH’S HOUSE - DAY 61 Zach knocks on the door. Josh’s Mom answers, she's a buttoned-up conservative woman who's been through a lot raising her three sons. Her name is JOAN.  62 65.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Hi there, Zach.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey, is Josh home?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: He is.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I was worried since he hasn’t been at school.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: He hasn’t been feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Can I see him?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Let me see if he's feeling up to it. She leads him into

dialogues.speaker: THE FOYER 62
dialogues.text: And walks down the hall to Josh’s room. She calls over he shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Shoes off! Zach steps on the heel of his left shoe, lifting his foot out of it. Down the hall, Joan knocks on his door.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Honey? Zach stopped by. There doesn’t seem to be a response. She shuffles back toward Zach and moves past him into the kitchen. JOAN (cont'd) Give him a minute. She returns with two cans of ginger ale which she hands t Zach. He hesitates. Is he supposed to go in, now? This is weird She gestures him forward. He stands outside Josh’s bedroom door. There’s NOISE comi from inside. Video game music.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s Zach.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: ...I know.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: ...Can I come in? No response.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I said ‘yeah’. Zach turns the knob and enters

dialogues.speaker: JOSH'S ROOM 63
dialogues.text: Josh is in the process of turning off the Super Nintendo. looks rough. Pajamas. Greasy hair. Has he even left the r since everything happened?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I haven’t seen you. I thought I should... you know...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Mom let me stay home.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You told her?!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What? No. I said I didn’t feel good.  67.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Oh. We shouldn’t... like, act weird or anything, though. Right? It’s been a week. Josh laughs derisively.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Okay, Zach.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: No, I mean... Just so-

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Okay. Zach sighs and sits in a nearby office chair, dropping th pretense. He just wants to see his friend. Josh remains on the floor. He starts pulling bits of fuzz from the carpet and rolling it into a ball with his finge

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sorry. How are you? Josh shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: No shit. I’m barely sleeping. My heart will just speed up sometimes. All of the sudden, just... He gestures. Josh stares at the little fuzz ball he’s mad pinching it between

dialogues.speaker: HIS FINGERS
dialogues.text: Bitten down nails. ZACH (cont'd) I feel like we should go back. This gets Josh’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. To check on him. To see. ...I had this dream... Josh looks at him a moment before dropping his eyes again focus on ee OF  68.

dialogues.speaker: A HOLE
dialogues.text: In the knee of Zach’s jeans. A small hole. Just the beginning of something larger.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s stupid.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Don’t go back there. Scene of the crime. Zach nods. He’s overcome with nervous energy.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Do uh...So do you have his stuff?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Daryl's stuff...his backpack, that video.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It's here. Josh nods to the corner of his room. Zach walks over and starts to look through it. He begins to well up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Ok...I guess, like, just keep it hidden? Josh doesn't respond. ZACH (cont'd) Josh, do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's here. Until I decide to burn it or something.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Well, don't do that. Don't do anything without talking to me first.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Whatever. Zach rolls his eyes and sits back down, trying to ease th discomfort of the conversation.  69.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What game is that? Josh says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Look man, it was a fucking accident. We didn't mean for anything to happen. Josh silently watches him border on a meltdown. Zach clenches the arms of the office chair. He suddenly punche himself fiercely, twice, on the head. ZACH (cont'd) Fuck! He gets it under control. Somewhat. Josh waits a beat.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: So did you bring my homework? This catches Zach off guard. They both laugh. Like this little shit matters now.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: No, but... Allison Bannister’s party’s tomorrow. We should probably go.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe... You know, I haven’t slept, either. Zach nods.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I probably should. Zach takes the hint. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Okay. If anyone asks, we didn’t see Charlie or Daryl that day.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: If anyone asks, we’re already fucked.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I guess... You should come to the party. You should come back to school. ee OF *

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don’t want to be alone. Zach stands to leave. He takes one last look around the r and is suddenly struck with the claustrophobia of this space, too much stuff. Too many action figures, and stacks of comic books, and video game cartridges spilling out of drawers. The TV see too big for its stand. And in the middle of it all Josh is sitting on the floor barefoot in pajama pants. He doesn’t look up as Zach turn and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is close to setting. Beautiful but eerie. Zach ri his bike down the street.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: He sees ANOTHER RIDER on a bike. ZACH Pedals harder to catch up to him. He gets within ten fifteen feet but can’t quite close the gap. But at this distance we can see the same thing that Zach can see. Thi looks like Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIDER
dialogues.text: Suddenly takes off! Hauling ass, pedaling away.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Narrows his eyes and follows, determined to keep up. He chases him down streets and around corners. The bikes zoo They leave the subdivision and take off onto the empty country roads. Eventually, the Rider turns off into a fie and disappears beyond a small hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach stands in the middle of the field, breathing heavily He lost him. ee OF *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 71. We should recognize the place even if Zach doesn’t seem t This is the field outside the woods where Daryl died. Zach looks toward the treeline and sees DARYL’S BIKE Lying on the ground. He leans in to inspect it. Then he hears something... a RUSTLING SOUND. Off in the distance. follows the SOUND into

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODS 66
dialogues.text: Of course. It’s coming from the leaf-strewn ditch. Zach approaches and peers down. Cautious now. Afraid. Something’s moving down there, writhing in the dead leave He picks up a heavy rock and hurls it. CRACK! He’s hit something. The writhing stops. Dead? Shit. Now what? He slinks down the ditch’s earthen wall, wanting to see w it is. What it was. He digs through the leaves, tossing t aside. Wait. There’s something. A leg: pale white skin. But it isn’t Daryl’s leg. It’s a girl’s leg. Bare. Zach stands. In a daze. Mesmerized. He grips the leg and pulls it, dragging a body into view.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Half naked. Underwear and undershirt. Dead and floppy. Lifeless. He awkwardly drags the corpse into his lap. His breathing ragged. He’s sweaty. Afraid. Afraid of being caught. Some seeing him like this. But he’s excited too. He leans in and kisses her cold lips. After and long, horrible moment, she finally kisses back. Her arms are suddenly thrown around him. She’s groggy, ha conscious. But alive. He lifts her, kissing fiercely, hungrily. Her legs wrap around him as well. He slams her back into the wall of th ditch.  72. His hips grind. His fingers tangle themselves in her hair They pull. She moans. It’s fast and violent and... Someone’s watching. Zach looks up.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is there, staring down without expression. Bathed in shad aside from a white hot reflection in his glasses. Zach doesn’t stop. It doesn’t faze him at all. His pants undone. He’s writhing against her. Dead leaves rustling. Josh watches coldly. Clinically. Thump, thump, thump. Allison’s head against the earthen wall. Her clouded, empty eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BARRON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Zach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach lifts his head from the desk. Mrs. Barron has her ha on his shoulder. The students in the surrounding desks ar all staring at him, Allison included.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BARRON
dialogues.text: Stay with us, please. He’s groggy, nauseated by his dream. Allison mouths to hi “You okay?” He nods. Not convincing.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Can I go to the bathroom? I feel a little sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach stands in front of the sink, staring down at the stiffness in his pants and the telltale damp patch surrounding it. Jesus, not just a weird sex dream but a w dream, too. He sighs and rolls his eyes, embarrassed. What the fuck i he supposed to do now? He runs the water, wets his hands wipes them on his pants, trying to camouflage the wet spo Fuck it. Who cares?  69 73. He leans back against the wall and slumps down, breathing heavily, trying to collect himself. Out in the hallway, the BELL RINGS. The hustle and bustle sounds of class-change pick up. Another KID walks in and goes to the urinal. Zach wipes his eyes and starts to lea Over his shoulder he can hear the other KID mocking him, making fake crying sounds. Zach pushes open the door to the hallway and doesn’t look back. He reaches out and POUNDS on a locker door. The sou of it echoes through the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sits alone with his headphones on, picking at a tray food. A group of 5 kids, 2 guys and 3 girls, gather at th table in front of him. He gives them a glance.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 1
dialogues.text: How much you want to bet they try and give us a curfew if this idiot doesn't show up soon?

dialogues.speaker: GUY 2
dialogues.text: That would blow.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 1
dialogues.text: Little bee-otch is gonna ruin it for everybody. Zach slides the headphones off one of his ears and perks

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 1
dialogues.text: Don't be a dick, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 1
dialogues.text: I'm just telling it how it is.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 2
dialogues.text: Oh snap, I just saw the craziest thing in Spanish class. You guys know Josh Templeton? Zach is now fully attentive, pulling his headphones off.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 1
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 2
dialogues.text: What'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OF  70 74.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 2
dialogues.text: Called Mrs. Campos the c-word! Swear to god. He came in all attitude today, totally ignoring her when called on him. So she goes "I don't recall you being deaf, Josh" and he was all "I don't recall you being such a dumb cunt!" The girls gasp. The guys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 3
dialogues.text: What did she say?!

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 2
dialogues.text: Sent him right to the office.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 2
dialogues.text: Just now?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 2
dialogues.text: Yeah, right before lunch. That's Zach's cue. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach hurries in. And sits in a chair in the waiting area. Next to him is a GOTH KID who listens to loud MUSIC on hi headphones. Zach sits low, hoping to go unnoticed by the SECRETARY wh sits behind the desk ten feet away. He cranes his neck, trying to see through the window of t principal's office across the room. Is Josh there, on the other side? After a moment the secretary sees him.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Can I help you? Zach stammers to make something up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: My mom said she was gonna call me during lunch. So I thought I'd just wait here for a minute to see... She seems suspicious. HK eH  71 72 75.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Okay. But only until class starts. Zach leans back and looks again at the closed door to the principal's office... The music from the Goth Kid's headphones gets louder. Ste rhythmic THUMPING. INT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - PARTY 71 Zach enter's through the font door. There are a dozen kid around him, talking or listening to music on a boom box. He walks into

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM 72
dialogues.text: And finds pizza boxes strewn around the table. He rummage through them but comes up empty-handed.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Pizza went pretty fast. Zach is startled, he turns.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Hey, Zach.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey, Becca. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I'm good! Glad you showed up, Allison will be stoked.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yeah, silly.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: That's cool... Rebecca lauhgs at this.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Right. So I pretty much barely know you. Even though we have English together. ee OF  73 76.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry. I'm shy I guess.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Doesn't change the fact that Allison digs you. And if she digs you then how could I not? Let's be friends, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sounds good. They shake hands theatrically. He looks over the milling crowd, has to raise his voice to be heard over the music

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I thought we were just gonna watch movies.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We were but then my grandpa got sick! Zach looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: So my parents went to visit him in Florida. Party got an upgrade. She grins and holds up a beer.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: So uh, where's Allison? I should say hi.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You so should. She’s out back. EXT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - PORCH - NIGHT 73 Zach steps out onto the porch. Tiki torches, Christmas lights. Much quieter. A smaller group engaged in conversation. Allison immediately rushes him, hugs him. She’s a little hyper tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh my god, you made it! She kisses him on the cheek and embraces him again.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hey, Zach. ee eK *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach’s eyes widen. Josh is here! Sitting in a deck chair nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey, man!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh! You guys should do the handshake! Both Zack and Josh wince a little, clearly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Eh. We don’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: We don’t really do that anymore. John Whitcomb speaks up from a few seats over. He of the Kool-aid blue hair.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WHITCOMB
dialogues.text: What handshake? Josh ignores him and pulls a small, wrapped packet out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Did you get me a present?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I thought we weren’t supposed to bring presents.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Open it. Allison excitedly does so to find a small baggie, contain some of the weed from Josh's brother’s room.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Whoa! Oh, I know how to do this, I think. Let me see if Becca has papers. She hurries inside.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WHITCOMB
dialogues.text: Where’d you get this shit, Josh?  78. Zach eyes Josh warily.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Guess I know a guy.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WHITCOMB
dialogues.text: Can you hook me up?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe. Hit me up tomorrow. Zach watches this exchange with suspicion. Allison follows Rebecca back onto the porch. She’s delicately holding a small piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Okay, its a page from a bible but its not an important one, its the introduction or something.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: The point is it’ll work. I’ve seen my brother do this a million times. Allison sits and dumps some of the weed onto the paper an makes a messy joint.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I think we have enough for two, but Allison gets to go twice to start because its her birthday. It takes a second for Allison to get the joint lit. She awkwardly takes a hit, then another. Coughs. Passes to Rebecca. Zach watches Josh, uncomfortable with all of this. He tur to him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m gonna head out.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: See ya. Clearly Josh plans on sticking around awhile. Zach stands Allison glances his way. He closes the door on cheers and laughter.  74 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is walking fast, emotionally strung out.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! You taking off?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t know, not much of a party guy. Just wanted to say happy birthday. Allison seems genuinely bummed.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s fine. I just got a lot going on right now.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: That’s why you smoke. To relax.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: But I’m not into that. And neither is Josh, he just brought all that to impress you, it’s fucking lame. She doesn’t respond. She lets his words hang there. He tu to her, not meeting her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Allison. I-

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Somebody's lying. Zach is startled.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What? Allison tilts her head to the house and smiles, swaying w Chris Isaac - "Somebody's Crying" in the background.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: The song...Chris Isaac. Best track on the album. She moves in for a kiss as he swings his head around and Their heads connect with a BANG.  75 76 80. ALLISON (cont'd) Ah!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sorry! I’m sorry. She starts giggling. He reaches out to touch her head and suddenly instinctively kisses it where they collided. She stops giggling. He kisses her head again. Then her li He stops. They look at one another a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Happy Birthday Allison. She watches him walk off into the night. Alone, he picks speed. Jogging. Running through the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is in gym clothes running laps around the outdoor track. Other students are running as well in groups of threes and fours but Zach is keeping his own company, los in thought until he sees something. ZACH’S POV We see the flashing red and blue lights of police cars in the distance up on the road traveling toward the school.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Watches this with no small interest. The cars turn into t school parking lot and OFFICERS walk toward the building Zach continues running, going faster now, sprinting. His thoughts running wild in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sits on the bench in front of his locker, the energy around him is terrifying and unnerving. The other boys excitedly talking. Zach's in a daze, barely listening. On certain words reach him and resgister. Words like Dead, killed, body, cops. ee OF  77 78 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach slumps down at his desk, dejected. PHILIP, a kid wearing a baseball cap, sits down at the desk behind him.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Dude, you hear that shit? Zach turns around.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: That guy. He’s dead, they found him dead.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: who?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: John Whitcomb. The dude with the blue hair.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Wait what? He’s dead, he died?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Yeah, they found him this morning.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I know, right? I had Algebra with him. Small fucking world. Everything slows down and the sound drowns out. Zach's ey widen and his mind races. He slowly reaches his hand out over his desk for something, anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is unchaining his bike, preparing to head home. He glances over at

dialogues.speaker: THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: To see Eugene sitting in the back of a truck, surrounded a handful of other students. Including CHAD, the threaten figure from under the bleachers.  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach hesitantly approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Eugene. Can I talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: CHAD
dialogues.text: You can get your ass beat, faghole.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking to you. Ooohs from the surrounding students. But Eugene deflates situation, patting Chad on the back and leaping down from the bed of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: It's aight, I gotta dip, anyway. He holds up a CD case. EUGENE (cont'd) I'll get this back to you, tomorrow. Eugene heads to his own car. Zach follows, dodging a plas SODA BOTTLE thrown by Chad. EUGENE (cont'd) What's up, little man? You got my five dollars? Eugene reaches his car, tosses his backpack into the rear

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh didn't pay you? Danny's little brother.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Why do you think I'm asking you?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Have you seen him at all? He didn't try to sell you weed or anything? Eugene narrows his eyes, suddenly on the alert.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He's my friend.  80 83.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Well... It maybe came up. That little dude Chad hanged out with, with the blue hair, RIP, he had told me was gonna get some from your friend. Guess that's off, now, huh? Zach processes this, deeply troubled by the implications. EUGENE (cont'd) Tell you what, when you see him, remind him that he was supposed to come straight to me with that kind- bud. And next time you see me, you better have my five dollars. Or I'll let Chad beat it out of you. He grins, but not maliciously, revving his engine and pulling out, leaving Zach standing on the blacktop alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Allison are sitting side by side on the curb outside, drinking sodas, somber.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I walked in on him once. In the bathroom, the bus bathroom. On that field trip to the flight museum, you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I didn’t go.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, he didn’t lock the door for some reason. I saw everything. Full Whitcomb. She makes a “meh” face. They sit for a beat in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You’re friends with Tig right? She opens a pack of cigarettes and lights one.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: who?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Carol. Sharp. She was at your party. HO ee OH OF * eee OF

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Sorta.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You have her number?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Somewhere at home. I’1l1 have to look. Here. Got a pen? He digs one out of his pocket. She takes his hand and wri a number on his palm.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: My new number. My own line. Mom and dad’s birthday present. You won’t have to deal with my brother anymore. Call tonight and I’1l dig hers out for you... If you tell me why you want it. She smiles, Zach dodges the question.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Did you just buy that? She looks at the cigarette in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Is that okay? I don’t want to scare you off again. Zach seems uncomfortable. She playfully nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I’m messing with you, dummy. Everyone knows this guy will sell to anybody. Just gotta be patient sometimes. He glances around nervously, gestures toward the road.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s fine. But we should probably... You shouldn’t smoke it right here. You'll get him in trouble. She exhales and squints at Zach, casual. She doesn’t care

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Asshole sells cigarettes to kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks as Duke steps outside with new numbers to displ on the gas price sign by the road. He waves to them and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You found a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Uh... No, we-

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: She’s a cute one, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I’m serious. He is.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Okay... Allison speaks through her teeth quietly so as not to be overheard.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Told ya. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Come on. Be a good “boyfriend” and walk me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach walks his bike beside Allison.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You don’t think it’s weird? She shrugs, not really buying what he’s suggesting.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: He fell. People climb those towers in the pipeline all the time. You said you and Josh just did it. Makes sense that some people would fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he didn’t fall?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Zach takes a deep breath. Has she picked up on what he’s been hinting at? Maybe he shouldn’t have said anything.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: You think he jumped! Zach wrestles with himself. Should he tell her what’s rea on his mind?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe. You’re right, I guess it’s not that weird. Right? She narrows her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Why do you care so much? Zach doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: God, that made me sound like a dick didn’t it? “why do you care?” A kid in our class is dead. ...And that Daryl guy's still missing. They’ve reached her house. He walks her up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sorry. I just, lately, it feels like I don’t have anyone to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: ...It’s my fault, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: You and Josh. I could tell you two were... He’s got a thing for me. (off his look) Zach, I like you. A lot sometimes. But when are you going to stop being surprised at the fact that I’m not completely stupid?  82 83 87.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Probably now.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Now’s good. She kisses his forehead with a smirk and goes to the door Stops. Might as well be forward.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Do you want to come inside?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah. A beat. He doesn’t move from the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: But you’re not going to. He tries to think of something to say. All he can do is shake his head. Allison nods in response. She gives up on him, goes inside and closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach unlocks the door and walks inside, he can feel the silence.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Mom? ! He takes his shoes off and walks into the

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN 83
dialogues.text: And pours a huge glass of orange juice. The answering machine is flashing. He presses the button hear his mother speaking:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, honey! I’m gonna be home a little late, so eat whatever you feel like for dinner. Just don’t go anywhere. I’11l be home as soon as I can. I love you. She makes a kissing sound. He kisses back. He stands alon in the kitchen for a moment, debating. Then heads back ou the door.  84 85 86 87 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach pedals furiously out of the neighborhood and down

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRY ROADS
dialogues.text: He’s hurrying somewhere, biking as quickly as he can. On toward that familiar

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: He parks his bike and walks through the tall grass into

dialogues.speaker: THE FOREST
dialogues.text: A grim retracing of his steps. He walks carefully, almost respectfully. This is, after all, a graveyard of sorts. For a few moments he seems lost, looking around in every direction, trying to determine where they had been. They were running after him, but which way... Then he spots th drop off up ahead

dialogues.speaker: THE DITCH
dialogues.text: Where Daryl took his last spill. Zach approaches slowly and as he reaches the edge of the drop, he can see the scene from above. But it’s wrong. Something is out of place here. Zach can see

dialogues.speaker: THE PILE OF LEAVES
dialogues.text: That he and Josh had covered Daryl’s body with, but it’s thinner and more scattered now. Someone’s been here. DARYL’S BODY Is slightly uncovered. An arm exposed. A hand. Zach works up the nerve to climb down and get a closer lo He steps with caution, not wanting to leave any sign of h presence and needing to keep a certain distance from the body. He squints at the exposed 84 85 86 87  88 89.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: The fingers are missing. Sliced clean off. He leans in. W the fuck? He kicks a few of the leaves off, trying to see more. There are

dialogues.speaker: STAB WOUNDS
dialogues.text: In Daryl’s back. Half a dozen. He kicks off more leaves a finally gets a good look at DARYL’S HEAD Zach can’t look at it for long, maybe only a glimpse, but The skull’s been crushed. He stumbles, weak in the knees for a moment before realiz that whatever happens, he can’t stay. He gathers himself turns to go. He stops on his way to check

dialogues.speaker: THE HOLLOW TREE
dialogues.text: But both the sword and Zach's sweatshirt are gone.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Shit. He paces, worked up, frustrated, tense beyond belief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach grabs the phone and glances at his hand to dial Allison’s private number. She answers quickly, a smile in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey... do you have that number? She is suddenly cold and businesslike.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Yeah, hang on. Zach listens as she puts the phone down, angry at himself scared out of his mind.  90. 89 INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - EVENING 89 Charlie’s working on an enormous desktop computer. The ph rings behind him. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sharp residence.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Charlie? It’s Zach.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: ...How’d you get my number?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Listen.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Shit... Okay I’1l just say it... it’s Josh.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What’s Josh?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: The killer. I think he Killed John Whitcomb. 90 INT. KAREN’S CAR - EVENING 90 Karen is driving down the road, listening to the radio. H headlights fall on a kid on a bike in front of her. A blu hoodie. She pulls up beside him and rolls her window down

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Josh? He stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Mrs. Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach clutches the phone, pacing.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Killer? Zach what the hell...  91.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m still figuring it all out but I had to talk to somebody who knew and you’re the only who does, so... I’ve tried talking to Josh but there’s something wrong with him. He was so pissed at Daryl for ganking his brother’s pot but the other night he just gave it away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah, to this girl we know as a gift and he said he'd sell some to John Whitcomb.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He hated John Whitcomb. Him and those guys he hung out with.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What guys? Zach-

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Forget it, doesn’t matter. I’m saying like a week ago Josh was talking about how much he hated John Whitcomb and now John whitcomb turns up dead in the pipeline where we hung out with Daryl that day? He was gonna sell him the pot! Like that story Daryl told us. He said he would sell to him, lured him out there and got him alone so he could kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is standing on the side of the road. She’s pulled ov now.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be out here like this at night. Not with everything that's been going on. Where are you headed?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I was actually on my way to see Zach.  93 92.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: We haven’t seen you around lately. Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: We had a fight the other day-

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s between you two. I’11 keep my nose out but you shouldn’t be out here alone. Get in. You can put the bike in the back. INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - EVENING 93

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Alright, he’s acting weird. So are you! So am I, probably.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I know, but I couldn’t stop thinking about it. I went back out to the woods where Daryl was but it was different, someone else had been there before me, he was moved around and-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You went out there? What did-

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Look, the sword was gone. The tree was uncovered and the sword was gone, along with my sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But - -

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Three people knew about the sword. You, me and Josh. And I don’t think you went back out there alone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. ee eK * ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Josh did and I think he took the sword and messed with Daryl then he pushed John Whitcomb off of that tower and I don’t know what he’s doing now. I called but there’s no answer. Charlie sits with the phone against his ear, emotionless. His blank expression becomes one of disgust

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That's so fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I know, I still can't bel--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why would you add all this nonsense onto the situation? Isn't it bad enough as it is? Daryl's dead, isn't that enough drama for you?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: We don’t know he was dead.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He looked pretty dead. Did you check for a pulse?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking Doogie Howser! Yeah, I thought he was dead. But either way someone went back there. And if they found him alive then they finished him off. And if he was dead then they were just fucking around with the body. And that’s even worse!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It wasn’t me. And it wasn’t you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So it was Josh? He’s your friend, isn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah. HO ee OH OF  94 94.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So why go out of your way to put this on him? I think we're all to blame for what happened to Daryl, all three of us. Don't just blame him to avoid feeling guilty about it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Then where’s the sword?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Leave it alone, Zach!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Did you take it?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No! Did you? How do I know you didn’t take it? How do I know it’s even gone? Want to take me out and show me? Lure me back out there? You, me, no witnesses? No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself. You’re losing it. Don’t call again. Charlie hangs up. Zach sits in the empty living room.

dialogues.speaker: LATER 94
dialogues.text: Zach idly eats leftovers, while half paying attention to whatever horrific movie is on TV. There are periodic SCREAMS, but they don't faze him. Eventually, Karen bursts in, her arms full of stuff (purs mail, briefcase, fast food bags).

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Look who I found! Zach turns to see Josh standing right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hey.  95. Karen can sense the tension. Tries to break it.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I got chicken. Zach looks at his empty bowl.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You told me to eat whatever.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Did I say that? Bah. It’1l reheat. Josh, you want some?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nah, I shouldn’t stay long.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: We’1ll be outside a minute. Karen watches them step out through the garage. 95 EXT. ZACH’S HOUSE 95

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I don't know. I wanted to say hi. And I guess apologize for ditching you at the party.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You didn’t, I ditched you.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I guess so. It would've been cool to hang out. It was a fun party. Josh seems sincere, almost vulnerable. But Zach is too focused to see it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Look, someone went out there. They took the sword and-

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Can't we just talk-  96 96.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: That doesn't surprise you? That someone took the sword? Did you go back out to see him?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why the fuck did you go back out there?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Just to look.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is this all we can do now?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You want to hang out? John Whitcomb is dead too, now. What the fuck is that all about? Josh turns and walks away. Leaving Zach to stand and wond how this could've gone better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horror movie still playing on the television. Karen looks up from her plate of chicken and watches Zach enter the room. She drinks from a bottle of beer.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: He left?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I wish you'd told me. I could've driven him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He’1l be fine.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Are you going to be fine?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s ok. It’s not a big thing.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: They found that Whitcomb boy. That’s two in a week. * * ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OF  97 98 97. Zach nods. Nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I keep thinking if I was his mother... She’s tearing up just imagining it. Zach fidgets on the couch, pretending to focus on the movie as she sniffles a quietly beside him. KAREN (cont'd) Come here.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Come here. Fucking hug me! Jesus. He obeys, scooting over to her awkwardly. She embraces hi He lets it happen. It’s a tender moment for her. She stro the back of his head, rocking him softly. On screen someone is SCREAMING and SCREAMING. Karen doesn even notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sits at his desk as the teacher talks about Wutherin Heights or some other classic. His attention is elsewhere He’s hypnotized by

dialogues.speaker: THE CARDBOARDED WINDOW
dialogues.text: This must be the room that the deer ran into. The duct ta holding the cardboard in place has come loose. The wind i picking up outside. It whistles. The cardboard flaps.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Looks over at him. He doesn’t even notice. She leans over and continues whispering to Rebecca beside her. The wind keeps howling outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is quiet. Zach opens the fridge a grabs a BEER BOTTLE from the back. After a moment's thought, he reache in and grabs another.  99 98. INT. ZACH’S ROOM - AFTERNOON 99 Zach sits on his bed sipping beer. The familiar YEARBOOK in his lap, but now instead of looking at girls, Zach loo at a photo of

dialogues.speaker: HIMSELF
dialogues.text: It wasn’t long ago, but he seems so much younger. After a moment he flips a few pages and scans the names intently until he finds

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WHITCOMB
dialogues.text: And finally

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He closes the book, lays his head back. Suddenly, he's startled by a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sweetie? It’s for you.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: who is it?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Ralphie. Zach makes a face. Who the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s locked. He unlocks the door and takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Why is it locked?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Sorry. I didn't know you were home. She offers him the phone and a raised eyebrow before retreating down the hall. ZACH (cont'd) Hello?  100 99.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Turn the news on, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just turn it on.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What channel?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Who’s your cable provider? Charlie sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: The channels might be different.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just find the local news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach sits on the couch gazing at

dialogues.speaker: THE TV
dialogues.text: The news is on. Karen walks in with a cup of yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: The gas station. The convenience store they go to after school. The news camera zooms in on a shot of

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Being taken out in handcuffs by county police officers. T newscasters rattle on about "allegations of sexual assaul on minors" and how he's "being questioned regarding the recent disappearance of one local teen and the death of another."  101 102 103 100.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: That guy was always so weird.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Of course he is! They’re saying he killed that Whitcomb kid. Maybe now that they’ve caught him they’1l find that other one.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Daryl. If anything good can come out of this maybe they’1l find him alive. Zach says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach grimly pedals his bike down the street toward Josh's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach knocks, but there’s no answer. He checks to make sure he’s not being watched before reaching down to retrieve a spare key from under the welc mat, and slips inside. INT. JOSH’S HOUSE 103 The place is silent. Eerie. Zach breathes heavily as he creeps down the hall. His voice cracks when he calls out.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh? He lingers outside Josh’s bedroom. He kneels down and tri to peer under the door: nothing to see.  104 105 106 107 101. He knocks. Then knocks louder... At last he turns the kno

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately Zach sees a lump on the bed. It startles him, but it’s just bedding. Dirty clothes. He’s alone in the room. He starts to tear the place apart, searching. There got to be some clue... At last he finds

dialogues.speaker: A CORDLESS PHONE RECEIVER
dialogues.text: Lying at the foot of the bed. He picks it up and examines it. Who’s Josh been calling? A NOISE! A creak! Someone in the hallway? He slips around the corner...

dialogues.speaker: AN UGLY OLD DOG
dialogues.text: Shambles up to him, panting and coughing.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Jesus, Maggie. He gives her a pet and shoos her away. INT. JOSH’S HOUSE - HALLWAY 105 He starts toward the kitchen with the phone receiver stil in his hand but stops. INT. DANNY’S ROOM 106 Zach slips inside and makes his way to the closet. He ope the door... No samurai sword. An empty spot where it used to hang. INT. JOSH’S HOUSE - KITCHEN 107 Zach finds the base for the cordless phone. There’s a cal ID digital readout that shows recent numbers. He pushes the button to cycle through them. There’s one t shows up a couple times. Once just 15 minutes ago. And on before that. The day before...  108 109 110 102. He runs his hand through his hair... then looks at his op palm.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE NUMBER
dialogues.text: That Allison wrote on his hand. It's smudged and barely visible. It’s the same number. Josh has been calling Allison? Where is he now? EXT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON 108 A doorbell rings. Josh stands outside on the step. He has duffle bag over his shoulder. After a beat the door opens and we see Allison and Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Hey, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hi, Allison.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You should come in.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I'd love to. INT. JOSH’S HOUSE - KITCHEN 109 Zach stands thinking. The pieces are coming together... h interrupted by the SLAM of a car door from outside. He lo and sees

dialogues.speaker: JOSH'S FAMILY
dialogues.text: Joan, Josh's Dad and younger brother, all walking up to t house. No Josh. That's all Zach needed to see. He runs an bursts out the front door, just as Joan is opening it.

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Zach? Where did you-- INT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM 110 Josh leans against the wall, silently drinking an entire glass of milk. Allison and Rebecca sit opposite him, wait patiently. Techno MUSIC plays from a room somewhere deeper in the house.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: So, so.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: So you went to that “guy” you know? How much and how much? Josh removes the baggie of weed from his hoodie pocket an hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: This much and on the house. Rebecca grabs him and kisses him on the lips playfully.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: This guy’s awesome. They both turn to

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Standing by a little nervously.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Zach’s not coming, is he? She doesn’t do a very good job hiding her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No, he said he couldn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach is racing, panting, making his way to Allison’s hous He drops his bike and bounds up the stairs to her front door. He frantically knocks and rings the bell. INT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM 112

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: More for us! Come on. She leads the way down the hall, toward the music. Josh a Allison are alone for a moment. They laugh awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
