dialogues.text: Ladies first.  104. 113 EXT. ALLISON’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON 113 At long last, the door opens, revealing Allison’s brother DENNIS, 24, shaved head, blue work shirt, smoking a cigarette with a cordless phone pressed to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (to phone) Shit yeah, uh huh, hold on... (to Zach) What?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Uh, is... I’m Zach.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Is Allison home?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Zach. Dennis smirks a condescending smirk.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I’m messing with you.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I know. Don’t. Don’t do that. Is she here?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: She’s not. Dennis shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I think she's with that bitch from down the street...

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What bitch?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Rebecca whatever.  114 115 105.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Her house I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Was there a guy with them?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Man, fuck off. He waves goodbye and shuts the door. Zach stands silently panicking for a moment, every second might count here and doesn’t know what to do. He rings the bell again. And again. And again. Dennis ope the door.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: If Allison doesn’t call you in twenty minutes, call the police. Tell them to get to that bitch Rebecca’s house down the street.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Listen-

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes, I’m not fucking kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach runs. Trying to remember which house was Rebecca’s. takes a wrong turn and ends up in a cul-de-sac. He panics and doubles back.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Shit shit shit! Where was it? INT. REBECCA’S ROOM 115 Allison and Rebecca are goofing off and dancing to the mu on the CD player. Trading swigs from a bottle of white wi and hits off a joint.  116 106.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Just sits, watching, smiling. Allison offers him the join but he just shakes his head, politely declining.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m good. *

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: You sure? I thought we were hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We are! She grabs the joint from Allison and puffs... exhaling th smoke in Josh’s face and laughing before looking down to his open duffle bag and... *

dialogues.speaker: THE SWORD
dialogues.text: She takes it out and holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Whoa, what the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: That is a fucking sword. (to Josh) Can we see it?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You're doing it. The two girls play with it some more, miming like they're fighting. Precariously swinging the sword all around, mak sound effects. JOSH continues watching calmly. Eventually he gets up and approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Okay, my turn. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach hurries up the street. He spots the house. And sure enough Josh's bike is parked outside. * He walks to the front door. He tries the knob and it’s * unlocked. He turns it and steps inside.  117 107. INT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON 117 None of the downstairs lights are on. The sun is setting outside, the house growing dim and eerie. Zach darts his eyes around the room, looking for anything indicate what he might be stepping into here. He sees nothing. But he hears... THE MUSIC playing from somewhere down the hall. And above that... A WHIMPER... He freezes, stock still. His eyes go wide. What did he just hear? Muffled VOICES. He moves to the fireplace and digs through the fireplace tools. No poker? He settles for the shovel and starts dow

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: With a few doors on either side, bathrooms or closets but the end of the hall, straight ahead...

dialogues.speaker: A DOOR
dialogues.text: Open just a crack. Pink light spills out from inside, acr the carpet. The MUSIC is more present now. THE WHIMPER is louder and more resonant. It’s not yelps o coos, it’s one long sustained, but muffled MOAN that has peaks of high squealing which are louder in volume. Zach moves slowly. THE MOANING is louder and louder. It’s a painful, awful sound. The MUSIC underscores it all. Zach walks all the way up to the door and peers in

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE CRACK
dialogues.text: Just a sliver of the scene is enough. He can see ALLISON least. Her head hanging down so that her long hair obscur her face. She’s the one moaning. Whatever’s happening can be good... He pushes the door open slightly. Now he can see that she has her shirt off. Barefoot in a white bra and shorts. He hands are bound and she is gagged, sitting on the floor. He can see that she is trembling and that there is blood and around her feet. Rebecca is lying on the bed. She’s not moving.  118 108. Josh comes into view. His back is to the door. Zach can’t see his face but it’s clearly him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Is panicked. Devestated. He stands there a moment, trying decide what to do. Allison Notices him. Her eyes widen. Josh turns. The boys make eye contact. Zach is tearing up

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh. Josh SLAMS the door shut. Allison SCREAMS through the gag Zach throws his shoulder against the door. No good. He ki and stomps. ZACH (cont'd) Josh!! You fucking fuck!!! There’s a clatter and a CRASH from the other side of the door. Then more screams. Suddenly not just frightened but terrified. Pleading. Then a THUD. And SCREAMS of pain. The door won’t give at all. Something’s blocking it. Zach gives up on it and charges back outside. EXT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - EVENING 118 Zach runs around the side of the house, shouting at the t of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: HELP! HELP ME! SOMEBODY! HE’S KILLING

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: He finds the window that must lead into Rebecca's room. H bashes at it with his shovel. Worthless. There’s a DECK CHAIR. He grabs that and starts pounding. Muffled SCREAMS emanate from inside. Zach hoists that chair, swings for all he’s worth. The window breaks. He forces the screen out of his way an climbs in, taking his little fireplace shovel with him.  119 120 109. INT. REBECCA’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 119 The place is a wreck. Pink walls. Red floors. Clothes strewn about. And a sizable BOOKSHELF on the floo in front of the door. That must be what had been keeping out... but it’s pulled aside now. And the door is open. Josh is gone. ALLISON is writhing weakly in the corner. Zach races to h side. Her head hangs forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK HER NECK
dialogues.text: Is horrific. There are bruises and lacerations. Deep ones Josh tried to use the sword on her neck, to cut off her head. Not quite bamboo grade. Sharp enough to cut through milk cartons. This is what it does to a human neck. To Allison’s neck. These horrible, ragged hacks. She’s barely moving. Losing consciousness. Zach cries out He screams for help again. The house CREAKS. He realizes for the first time that Josh might still be here. Allison has gone limp in his arms. He sets her down and stands, watching the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Josh? He stoops to collect his shovel and steps toward the doorway. He takes a deep breath, pulls the door open and steps out into

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY 120
dialogues.text: He swings his shovel, but connects with nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Jo- But then Josh rounds the corner, sword in hand. Zach goes low and tackles him. The two boys grapple with each other. It’s not unlike the earlier confrontation between Zach and Daryl. Eventually, Zach manages to get free. He scurries back an stands.  110. They face one another. ZACH (cont'd) What the fuck? Josh, what the fuck?! Josh just stares at him, shaking. Zach is terrified. Adrenaline surging through him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is she dead?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Her brother called the police.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I don’t care. There's an emptiness in Josh's voice. He continues to sta there. Shaking. Zach’s shaking now, too.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Please please please don’t. Okay? Josh? Josh starts breathing heavier. Huffing. Puffing. Working himself up. There’s nothing behind Zach but a bathroom. He has to get Josh if he wants to get out. He makes a break for it, dashing forward and to the side, trying to dodge around Josh and his sword. He makes it but Josh is right behind him. He swings the sword, hitting Zach in the shoulder. Not sharp enough to slice deeply into him, but sharp enou to cut. And fucking hurt. Zach SCREAMS. Josh brings the sword down hard, to Zach's head. CRACK! Right on the top of Zach’s skull, splitting the skin. CRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood streams down Zach’s face. He collapses. Josh is on top of him, stabbing frantically with the swor Zach squirms around and manages to kick Josh back. He gets to his feet and stumbles out the front door, into the yard.  111. 121 EXT. REBECCA’S HOUSE - EVENING 124 Zach races out as fast as he can go. Josh comes bounding after him. Josh bellows and takes another swing.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Stands in the doorway of one of the nearby houses. She watches silently. Josh catches up with Zach. He swings again. Zach’s ankle twists beneath him and he falls into the street. Josh straddles him again. This time when he stabs he make contact. He pierces Zach’s thigh. Zach grabs the blade and shifts to the side, pulling it o forcing it away from him.

dialogues.speaker: A CAR
dialogues.text: Drives past. Slows. Then speeds the fuck up and peels out Dogs start barking in the distance. And beyond that... SIRENS. Zach swings blindly up at Josh, trying to fend him off. J doesn’t give a shit. With his free hand, he swings back. But suddenly A MAN rushes up behind Josh and catches him under the arms, pulling him away from Zach. The Man holds tight against Josh's struggles. In a rage Zach stands and rushes at Josh. Takes a good, cheap swing. The Man tries to pull Josh away. He’s shouting at Zach, trying to calm him down.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE
dialogues.text: Are out now. All standing in their yards. Staring. Nervou The Man’s actions have made others braver, though. More c to help restrain the kids. Josh manages to wriggle free and collapse on the blacktop Before anyone can seize him, Zach rushes over. He KICKS J in the face. The people stand watching.  122 123 112.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Comes running over from his house, surprised at the sudde activity.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is through fighting back. He just lies there.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Kicks again. And STOMPS and SCREAMS. The Man is able to subdue Zach just as the red and blue lights of the police cars arrive. The sirens drown out everything. Others are helping Josh to his feet, holding him up. The Man holds Zach back. It’s not necessary, however. The fury is gone. He’s spent. He’s done. He and Josh make eye contact with one another. ZACH’S FACE Still shows emotion. JOSH’S FACE Holds none. The two boys are stuck there. They stare at each other un police come and handcuff each of them and put them in separate cars.

dialogues.speaker: IN ONE CAR 122
dialogues.text: Josh sits staring off.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEAT-BACK
dialogues.text: In front of him is black vinyl, cracked in a few places w heat and age. Josh stares into these lines, cracks, creas There is nothing more interesting.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE OTHER CAR 123
dialogues.text: Zach leans back and looks  124 125 126 127 128 113.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: He sees all of the activity of police taping off the area and holding the onlookers back. Rebecca's parents pull up their car, totally confounded. He sees paramedics wheel out two gurneys. Dennis runs up alongside the one that clearly carries Allison. She reach up to take his hand. He gets into the back of the ambulan with her before it speeds away. Zach smiles slightly. She’s alive. He looks down at his handcuffed HANDS, moving them a bit despite the restraint Finally he settles with them in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Time has passed. Winter has moved on. Spring is here. A deer stands alone, picking at some plants when suddenly looks up. It stares into the forest at something unseen. wind picks up. Trees sway. The deer takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking across the soccer field, it b-lines towards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It catapults towards the school, just like before, but ri before it's about to smash into a window it comes to a grinding stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison jumps up from sleep with a gasp, drenched in swea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands. Eyes closed, the water cascading down her fac 124 125 126 127 128  129 130 131 132 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits at the table eating a bowl of cereal. Dennis sit next to her. Her mother comes in and gives her a kiss on head and whispers something into her ear. Allison nods. H mother smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison stares out the window as Dennis drives her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison stands at her locker, staring into it. After a moment she grabs her AP History book and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher lectures. The students take notes. Allison fiddles with her pony tail unconsciously, then slowly bri her hand down to her neck where she gently rubs the scars that remain there. It's healed now as time has passed, bu its still a visible relic of something terrible. A MALE STUDENT sits behind her. He stares at her pony tai and then down at the back of her neck. Without looking back Allison undoes her pony tail and let her hair down, covering up the scar. The teacher asks a question. Allison raises her hand

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
